introduction: In this video, Sasha C, a UX designer studying Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) at Depaul University, provides insights into the field, its job opportunities, and the skills required. The video covers the basics of HCI, classes taken during the degree, and the importance of gaining experience in the field.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Human-Computer Interaction
content: HCI is a field that focuses on understanding the connection between computers and people.
It involves designing systems that improve businesses or people's lives.
Examples of HCI roles include UX designers, UI designers, information architects, and tech startups.
The major in HCI provides a foundation for various careers in the field.

sections.title: Section 2: Classes in Human-Computer Interaction
content: Sasha has taken classes such as User Research Methods, Statistics and Data Analysis, Website Design, Scripting for Interactive Systems, and HCI Fundamentals.
These classes cover topics like information architecture, user experience, and frontend development.
The classes provide a comprehensive understanding of HCI concepts and skills.
Sasha recommends studying HCI if interested in solving problems through technology.

sections.title: Section 3: Importance of Gaining Experience in HCI
content: Experience is crucial for HCI professionals to gain knowledge in the field.
Sasha suggests finding clients or working on personal projects to gain experience.
HCI involves various skills like inner personal skills and business acumen.
Gaining experience helps professionals develop these skills and stand out in the industry.

sections.title: Section 4: HCI and Coding
content: Sasha mentions that coding is a part of HCI, especially for frontend development.
Introductory classes usually involve coding, but not extensively.
Learning the basics of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS is essential for HCI professionals.
Sasha advises that coding skills can be quickly learned and applied in the field.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion and Recommendations
content: Sasha emphasizes the importance of studying HCI if interested in solving problems through technology.
The major provides a strong foundation for various careers in the field.
Gaining experience through projects or working with clients is crucial for HCI professionals.
Sasha recommends studying HCI if you are passionate about the topic.
